title: Bennett Gillig
subtitle: writes cool code sometimes
description: College senior who's interested in writing high-performance code, open source software and rhythm games. Read more on my personal website: andorlando.github.io.

content.title: Software Engineer Intern for Mathworks
content: Created an MCP server for requirement management tooling to allow for Agentic workflows, enabling PDF import, requirement-to-code linking and verification, and code from requirement generation among other workflows
Integrated in-house LLM API with external tooling (semantic-kernel) allowing for easy MCP/Agent integration
Used mentioned integration to create the first MCP client at Mathworks that supports said in-house API

content.title: SoC Debug Engineer Intern for Intel
content: Created an internal monitoring tool to automatically scan and report system state for debuggers and lab techs
Created a line profiler for an internal Python testing framework that worked on both consumer and datacenter CPUs
Created a tool to standardize, locate and categorize entries into a bug-tracking database for future debugging efforts

content.title: Lab Leader for Digital Ready
content: Supervised and mentored high-school students for through a Roxbury Community College course
Oversaw deliverables such as a Python card game project, portfolio website and Google certificates in IT and UI/UX
Authored and delivered lectures, labs and activities

content.title: Co-leader of Aspine club
content: Provided alternative grades portal written in vanilla JS to ~3,000 students
Wrote function to add tooltips to tagged elements, snackbars and a screen size-responsive action bar/side bar pair

content.title: Undergraduate Course Assistant
content: Taught for Programming Methodology, Computer Systems Principles, Introduction to Computation

content.title: Tutoring/Teaching (OLD)
content: 2x Undergraduate Course Assistant for Computer Systems Principles
Undergraduate Course Assistant for Introduction to Computation
Volunteered as tutor for Cambridge School Volunteers
Volunteered as Teaching Assistant for AP Computer Science A

content.title: Project Lead and Secretary for BUILD UMass pro bono
content: Prototyped and implemented blog website for IUCG using the MERN stack and AWS S3 cloud object storage
Collaborated with client iteratively throughout development
Oversaw a team of 6 software developers and 2 project managers

content.title: Research
content: With Syslab: Contributed to MAGI, a Gradescope autograder generator. Extended to TypeScript assignments

With PLASMA: Contributed to RightTyper, a runtime Python type-annotation engine created for Amazon Web Services. Worked on type parametrization logic, concrete syntax tree modification, and testing against existing type engines

content.title: RISC-V.js for HackUMASS XI
content: Won Best Software Hack and Best Security Hack in HackUMASS XI
Emulates a RISC-V processor (specifically the rv32ima+zicsr/zfenci instruction set) in the browser
Runs most binaries compiled for said instruction set in the browser and has basic I/O

content.title: Hackathon Wins
content: Winner at HackUMass XI out of 88 projects, RISC-V.js emulated a RISC-V processor (rv32ima) in the browser and could run (almost) any arbitrary binary compiled for its instruction set

Winner at HackHer413 out of 36 projects, Bad Apple in Google Calendar used ffmpeg to turn a video into frames, in house JavaScript code to turn frames into scaled pixel matrices and then into more optimized calendar events, then the Google Calendar API in order to upload them to a calendar

Winner at HackUMass XII out of 44 projects, Onedef is a cross-language communication specification which we implmented for JavaScript, Python and C++ allowing you to write a function in one language and call it in another

content.title: bfbbfb: Bennett and Felix Bootstrap Brainfrick from Brainfrick
content: Created domain specific language that compiles Python to Brainfrick, which is used to fully boostrap Brainfrick
Created Brainfrick self-compiler in DSL which compiles Brainfrick to x86, Arm, obfuscated C or Brainfrick itself
Created a turing-machine simulator in DSL, proving Brainfrick turing-complete by simulation

content.title: Rubato
content: Inbetweening library for awesomeWM written in Lua
Uses inverse kinematics to interpolate positions, allowing for animation interruptions with continuous velocity
~1900 peak biweekly downloads and ~240 stars on GitHub, is the premier animation library for awesomeWM

content.title: Color
content: Color conversion library for awesomeWM written in Lua
Converts seamlessly between RGB, HSL and hex in a highly optimized fashion
~800 peak biweekly downloads, ~30 stars on GitHub

content.title: save-manager
content: Cross-platform version control for files at arbitrary locations written in Rust
Fully fleshed out command line interface including subcommands and flags using clap
CLI inspired by git branches in order to allow saving and loading with no other arguments

content.title: Beauty in Code
content: Machine learning model written in Python that determine whether arbitrary code is aesthetically pleasing
Uses 14 features including fitting the tabs to up to a 10th order polynomial series
Predicts absolutely nothing useful but is cool anyways

content.title: Homework Scripts
content: Simple bookmark that automates multiple homework assignment websites
Zybooks automatically finishes completion sections of zybooks and finishes a course's worth of homework in ~2 hrs
WebAssign opens JavaScript repl where displayed matrices are local variables on which you can perform matrix arithmatic
KendallHuntContent script automates storage and retrieval of practice test questions using localStorage with a fully-featured UI and data transfer

content.title: randmst
content: Project for CS124 Data Structures and Algorithms at Harvard, written in C
Randomly generates graphs in dimensions 1-4 by placing points on a unit line, square, cube and hypercube, then finds the distance of the minimum spanning tree between the nodes using Prim's algorithm
Tested for up to 2^18 points in each dimension
